item.title: European markets fall on Fed outlook; Sweden's Riksbank cuts rates
item.description: European markets fell sharply Thursday, following their global counterparts lower.

item.title: Putin admits Russian inflation is an 'alarming signal' and the economy is 'overheating'
item.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday said that inflation is a problem in Russia and that the country's economy is overheating.

item.title: Dow futures are little changed after index drops 1,100 points in 10th straight loss: Live updates
item.description: Wall Street was previously betting on the Fed keeping an aggressive rate-cutting stance through 2025, hoping to extend the bull market.

item.title: Wharton's Jeremy Siegel says stock sell-off is 'healthy' as cautious Fed gives investors a 'reality check'
item.description: Wharton's Jeremy Siegel expects the Fed to pare back the number of rate cuts next year, with just one or two reductions.

item.title: Bank of Japan holds rates at 0.25%, yen weakens to over four-month low
item.description: The decision comes a day after the U.S. Federal Reserve cut rates by 25 basis points, bringing the federal funds rate to 4.25%-4.5%.
